Detailed Description

Default plugin to view a single row of a table. This is really just a wrapper around a theme function.

Member Function Documentation

views_plugin_row::init ( &$  view,
&$  display,
$  options = NULL 
)

Initialize the row plugin.

Reimplemented in views_plugin_row_node_view.

views_plugin_row::option_definition (  ) 

Information about options for all kinds of purposes will be held here. 

 'option_name' => array(
  - 'default' => default value,
  - 'translatable' => TRUE/FALSE (wrap in t() on export if true),
  - 'contains' => array of items this contains, with its own defaults, etc.
      If contains is set, the default will be ignored and assumed to
      be array()

  ),
Each option may have any of the following functions:
  • export_option_OPTIONNAME -- Special export handling if necessary.
  • translate_option_OPTIONNAME -- Special handling for translating data within the option, if necessary.

Reimplemented from views_object.

Reimplemented in views_plugin_row_aggregator_rss, views_plugin_row_comment_view, views_plugin_row_node_rss, views_plugin_row_node_view, views_plugin_row_search_view, and views_plugin_row_fields.

views_plugin_row::options_submit ( $  form,
&$  form_state 
)

Perform any necessary changes to the form values prior to storage. There is no need for this function to actually store the data.

views_plugin_row::render ( $  row  ) 

Render a row object. This usually passes through to a theme template of some form, but not always.
